title: IP Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP)
abstract:
This document describes an updated version of the Encapsulating Security
Payload (ESP) protocol, which is designed to provide a mix of security
services in IPv4 and IPv6.  ESP is used to provide confidentiality,
data origin authentication, connectionless integrity, an anti-replay
service (a form of partial sequence integrity), and limited traffic
flow confidentiality.  This document obsoletes RFC 2406 (November
1998).  [STANDARDS-TRACK]
